intro: Searsia scytophylla var. scytophylla, commonly known as the yellow flame bush, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers that appear in spring. The plant produces small, round, orange-red fruits that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it suitable for coastal and inland gardens.
